item.title: Current State of RevMetrix
item.description: RevMetrix System Architecture Current Status by Development Team Backend - Current StateAll details about the current state of the backend development, along with what is planned for the future Frontend - Current StateAll details about the current state of the frontend development, along with what is planned for the future Simulation - Current StateAll details about the current state of simulation development, along with what is planned for the future

item.title: How To Contribute
item.description: Table of Contents Contributing DocumentationHow to add, edit, and remove documentation on the Wiki DigitalOcean ManagementInformation regarding how to manage DigitalOcean Droplets Dockerizing an ApplicationInformation on how to dockerize a project and deploy onto a separate machine or server GitHub WorkflowsAll GitHub workflows for the project RevMetrix WebAPIInformation on how to use the WebAPI

item.title: initial Project Ideas
item.description: Original System Architecture Backend - Database ArchitectureUML diagrams representing the initial database architecture and schemas Phone App - Proof of ConceptDrawing board ideas for the layout and interaction methods of the phone application Simulation - First ThoughtsThe base ideas around using Unity for the development of a bowling simulation

item.title: Project Assignments
item.description: Overview Below you can find the list of project assignments completed throughout the fall 2023 semester and all of their details. List of Assignments Analysis and DesignDesign and Analysis Information and Links to the Document and Slideshow Project RequirementsDetails of the project requirements and the associated slideshow

item.title: Project Milestones
item.description: Overview Below you can find the assignment descriptions for each of the project’s milestones. There are three in total, and once the assignment date has passed, the appropriate slideshow can be seen under each milestone’s title. Milestones MS1 - Minimal Working SystemProgress made on the minimal working system and the associated slideshow MS2 - 50% Working SystemProgress made on the 50% working system and the associated slideshow MS3 - Final Working SystemProgress made on the final working system and the associated slideshow
